text: Vladicaris subtilis is an extinct arthropod from the early Cambrian period. Its fossils are found only in the Paseky Shale of the Czech Republic, alongside Kodymirus and Kockurus. It was small in size, with specimens ranging between 4 and 18 mm. Its carapace was oblong and round, with what may have been small appendages hidden beneath it. A short, segmented tail extended from its rear. ==References== Category:Prehistoric crustaceans
title: Vladicarus subtilis
